text: Mehri, or Mahri, is a Semitic language. It is spoken by tribes in Eastern Yemen and Western Oman by around 165,000 people. It has been spoken in the area since before Arabic was brought there.Abu Muhammad al-Hasan Hamdani, Sifat Jazirat al-'Arab (probably ed. 1884), 134 tr. ==References== Category:Semitic languages Category:Languages of Oman Category:Languages of Yemen Category:Kuwaiti culture
title: Mehri language
